page.title: 10Education
page.content: There are 3 schools in Wroughton, the infant school, the junior school and the senior school Ridgeway comprehensive. The infant school is about 100 years old, it was built in about 1880. At the moment it has 230 pupils. In 1914 it had 10 pupils that was built in the old part of Wroughton on Church Hill. In 1929 it was called Lower Wroughton Infant School. It was built for 180 pupils. At the moment there are 8 classes and 9 teaching staff. The pupils ages range from 5 to 7, they start school at 5 years and leave at 7 years old. The Junior school was built in 1964, it is 21 years old. It has 301 pupils at the moment and there are 10 classes and 13 teaching staff, 12 full time and 1 part time. The Senior school is called
